>@Compendium[sfrpg.class-features.wq8dRJYQ58VZQuZU]{First Vanguard Aspect}

You embody the total amount of potential work the energy in a system can perform when accessed by entropy.

@Compendium[sfrpg.class-features.Ib9Lkj71QWj7akKg]{Exergy Insight (Ex)} You gain Improved Combat Maneuver (trip) as a bonus feat and a +2 insight bonus to Intimidate checks.

@Compendium[sfrpg.class-features.uIC3dnxRBosrQ9DC]{Exergy Embodiment (Ex)} Once per combat, when you make two or more attacks in the same turn, you can gain 1 Entropy Point without taking any additional action.

@Compendium[sfrpg.class-features.cw3pEFiZ07czkWZN]{Exergy Catalyst (Su)} Each foe within 30 feet must attempt a Fortitude saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes an additional 1d6 damage per 2 vanguard levels from the next damaging attack that hits it within the next minute.

Improved: The additional damage is 1d6 per vanguard level.

@Compendium[sfrpg.class-features.RrmY1Bs7MttrKhbx]{Exergy Finale (Su)} When you hit a foe with your entropic strike and the attack roll is a natural 18 or 19 (meaning the d20 shows an 18 or 19), you can apply one critical hit effect of that attack to your target, but you do not double the damage. This critical hit effect is treated as a critical hit for purposes of abilities that affect critical hits. If you roll a natural 20, the normal critical hit rules apply instead.
